segment.source: Monitor claim types (Windows 10)
segment.target: Monitor claim types (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to claim types that are associated with dynamic access control when you are using advanced security auditing options.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to claim types that are associated with dynamic access control when you are using advanced security auditing options.

segment.source: Monitor claim types
segment.target: Monitor claim types

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to claim types that are associated with dynamic access control when you are using advanced security auditing options.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how to monitor changes to claim types that are associated with dynamic access control when you are using advanced security auditing options.

segment.source: Claim types are one of the basic building blocks of Dynamic Access Control.
segment.target: Claim types are one of the basic building blocks of Dynamic Access Control.

segment.source: Claim types can include attributes such as the departments in an organization or the levels of security clearance that apply to classes of users.
segment.target: Claim types can include attributes such as the departments in an organization or the levels of security clearance that apply to classes of users.

segment.source: You can use security auditing to track whether claims are added, modified, enabled, disabled, or deleted.
segment.target: You can use security auditing to track whether claims are added, modified, enabled, disabled, or deleted.

segment.source: Use the following procedures to configure settings to monitor changes to claim types in AD DS.
segment.target: Use the following procedures to configure settings to monitor changes to claim types in AD DS.

segment.source: These procedures assume that you have configured and deployed Dynamic Access Control, including central access policies, claims, and other components, in your network.
segment.target: These procedures assume that you have configured and deployed Dynamic Access Control, including central access policies, claims, and other components, in your network.

segment.source: If you have not yet deployed Dynamic Access Control in your network, see Deploy a Central Access Policy (Demonstration Steps).
segment.target: If you have not yet deployed Dynamic Access Control in your network, see Deploy a Central Access Policy (Demonstration Steps).

segment.source: Note: Your server might function differently based on the version and edition of the operating system that is installed, your account permissions, and your menu settings.
segment.target: Note: Your server might function differently based on the version and edition of the operating system that is installed, your account permissions, and your menu settings.

segment.source: To configure settings to monitor changes to claim types
segment.target: To configure settings to monitor changes to claim types

segment.source: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credential.
segment.target: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credential.

segment.source: In Server Manager, point to Tools, and then click Group Policy Management.
segment.target: In Server Manager, point to Tools, and then click Group Policy Management.

segment.source: In the console tree, right-click the default domain controller Group Policy Object, and then click Edit.
segment.target: In the console tree, right-click the default domain controller Group Policy Object, and then click Edit.

segment.source: Double-click Computer Configuration, click Security Settings, expand Advanced Audit Policy Configuration, expand System Audit Policies, click DS Access, and then double-click Audit directory service changes.
segment.target: Double-click Computer Configuration, click Security Settings, expand Advanced Audit Policy Configuration, expand System Audit Policies, click DS Access, and then double-click Audit directory service changes.

segment.source: Select the Configure the following audit events check box, select the Success check box (andthe Failure check box, if desired), and then click OK.
segment.target: Select the Configure the following audit events check box, select the Success check box (andthe Failure check box, if desired), and then click OK.

segment.source: After you configure settings to monitor changes to claim types in AD DS, verify that the changes are being monitored.
segment.target: After you configure settings to monitor changes to claim types in AD DS, verify that the changes are being monitored.

segment.source: To verify that changes to claim types are monitored
segment.target: To verify that changes to claim types are monitored

segment.source: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credentials.
segment.target: Sign in to your domain controller by using domain administrator credentials.

segment.source: Open the Active Directory Administrative Center.
segment.target: Open the Active Directory Administrative Center.

segment.source: Under Dynamic Access Control, right-click Claim Types, and then click Properties.
segment.target: Under Dynamic Access Control, right-click Claim Types, and then click Properties.

segment.source: Click the Security tab, click Advanced to open the Advanced Security Settings dialog box, and then click the Auditing tab.
segment.target: Click the Security tab, click Advanced to open the Advanced Security Settings dialog box, and then click the Auditing tab.

segment.source: Click Add, add a security auditing setting for the container, and then close all the Security properties dialog boxes.
segment.target: Click Add, add a security auditing setting for the container, and then close all the Security properties dialog boxes.

segment.source: In the Claim Types container, add a new claim type or select an existing claim type.
segment.target: In the Claim Types container, add a new claim type or select an existing claim type.

segment.source: In the Tasks pane, click Properties, and then change one or more attributes.
segment.target: In the Tasks pane, click Properties, and then change one or more attributes.

segment.source: Click OK, and then close the Active Directory Administrative Center.
segment.target: Click OK, and then close the Active Directory Administrative Center.

segment.source: Open Event Viewer on this domain controller, expand Windows Logs, and select the Security log.
segment.target: Open Event Viewer on this domain controller, expand Windows Logs, and select the Security log.

segment.source: Look for event 5137.
segment.target: Look for event 5137.

segment.source: Key information to look for includes the name of the new attribute that was added, the type of claim that was created, and the user who created the claim.
segment.target: Key information to look for includes the name of the new attribute that was added, the type of claim that was created, and the user who created the claim.

segment.source: Related resource
segment.target: Related resource

segment.source: Using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects
segment.target: Using advanced security auditing options to monitor dynamic access control objects
